intro: Perriera madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascan perriera, is a unique plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
